# UISceneDestructionRequestOptions

**Class**

An object you pass to UIKit to permanently remove a scene and its associated session from your app.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UISceneDestructionRequestOptions
```

## Overview

Create a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISceneDestructionRequestOptions] object before calling the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIApplication/requestSceneSessionDestruction(_:options:errorHandler:)] method of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIApplication]. When destroying a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWindowScene], create a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWindowSceneDestructionRequestOptions] object instead and use it to configure the dismissal animations.

## Managing a scene’s life cycle

- **activateSceneSession(for:errorHandler:)**: Asks the system to activate an existing scene or create a new scene and associate it with your app.
- **requestSceneSessionDestruction(_:options:errorHandler:)**: Asks the system to dismiss an existing scene and remove it from the app switcher.
- **requestSceneSessionRefresh(_:)**: Asks the system to update any system UI associated with the specified scene.
- **UISceneSessionActivationRequest**: A collection of properties that you use to request activation of a scene.
- **UIScene.ActivationRequestOptions**: An object that contains information you want the system to use when activating the session associated with a scene.
